subject: in_tree[N] alloc_cands with microversion 1.31
messages:
[{'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-08 09:26:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-08 12:02:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Again, haven't done a close review, but initial glance looks reasonable.

another todo is: update api-ref"}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-09 09:28:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-10 02:12:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-19 11:28:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

This looks pretty close, but there seems to be some confusion within about the use of in_treeN. It's documented and implemented in some places, but not documented in others, and there are no gabbi tests that exercise the treeN version (unless I was not looking carefully enough, which is possible)."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-21 22:32:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Thanks for bringing up the granular issue, Chris. I agree there's holes here.

I want to say I remember discussing it at the PTG, but the spec [1] doesn't mention in_treeN at all. Once we figure out the answers, it should be updated accordingly.

Option 1: Don't support in_tree in granular groups at all. If you want it, you have to specify it in the unnumbered group. CON: This would mean we have no way to support granular-only flavors. So I think this is a non-starter.

Option 2: Support it. It does what you expect. Namely:
- Specifying in_tree[N] in *any* group (including the unnumbered one) limits your whole request to that tree.
- If you specify more than one in_tree[N], they had better all refer to the same tree (test case for in_tree[N]s referring to different nodes in same tree) or you'll get an empty candidate list. Possibly add a courtesy check up front so this condition yields a useful log message.

Aside from the doc issues Chris points out, I'm pretty sure granular groups are busted as written. I marked where/why in the previous patch [2]. We need some test coverage to prove it either way.

Also test coverage with in_tree+sharing.

==========

Note to self: Microversion checklist [3] complete.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/approved/alloc-candidates-in-tree.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635722/2/placement/objects/resource_provider.py@3064 (and others)
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/placement/latest/contributor/index.html#microversions"}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-22 09:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-22 09:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-22 09:34:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yup, thanks for catching granular stuff that I have missed.

> If you specify more than one in_tree[N], they had better all refer to the same tree (test case for in_tree[N]s referring to different nodes in same tree) or you'll get an empty candidate list. Possibly add a courtesy check up front so this condition yields a useful log message.

Good point, but I don’t think so. Even for that case we can have non-empty candidate list *if sharing providers are in play*, which I think is a valid use case of this option. Added the test case for this and updated the release note to clear this use case."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-22 16:54:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Good update. Let's refine the wording for the sharing case, then I think we can land this."}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-24 07:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-24 16:32:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Good update.

One additional test case I'd like to see before we call this good.

I also started rebasing the "add second shared provider" patch, but I got in trouble for working on the weekend, so I'll finish that up tomorrow.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-25 03:52:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-25 03:55:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-25 09:07:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-25 09:19:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-25 11:10:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Thanks Tetsuro, this looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-25 14:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:21:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

Some nits within, none of which are enough to -1 but gonna +1 for now to give a chance for a respin since the parent has a -1 on it.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-25 19:01:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-25 19:01:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-25 19:02:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

I just fixed Chris's nits."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-25 20:29:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-25 21:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-03-25 23:45:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
in_tree[N] alloc_cands with microversion 1.31

This patch adds microversion 1.31 supporting the `in_tree`/`in_tree<N>`
query parameters to the `GET /allocation_candidates` API. It accepts a
UUID for a resource provider. If this parameter is provided, the only
resource providers returned will be those with the same tree with the
given resource provider.

Change-Id: I24d333d1437168f27aaaac6d894a18271cb6ab91
Blueprint: alloc-candidates-in-tree

commit_message:
Remove the unnecessary pv_list assign during LVM object init

The pv_list of LVM object actually wanted to be a list of dict of
physical volumes' info, but in the routine of creating a new vg,
we assign a list of physical volumes' name to it, which is unnecessary,
and also confuse people.

Change-Id: I5f74200e6df954258f261a30e9f5a5b56c6def2f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-24 21:40:11.000000000', 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I9523d943eb3c4c2582be3c00890292b1ced9e24e
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I9523d943eb3c4c2582be3c00890292b1ced9e24e

Thank you. LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-03-22 08:06:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(3 comments)

thanks!'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-03-22 08:41:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

As I mentioned above, I'd prefer this generic, not iLO-specific. Why wouldn't the same thing work for any boot interface using IPA?

Also I wonder if you want to support the same thing via driver_info."}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-03-22 09:46:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Dmitry: It is generic for any vmedia based boot interfaces. The config param and method to retrieve params is in common place. It does not cover PXE it is passed as kerenl params (config pxe_append_params covers it). For vmedia we pass them thorugh floppy as key=value pair through floppy. Any virtual media boot interface that want to support this has to just update their ramdisk params in prepare_ramdisk() by calling the generic method as done in iLO boot interface [1]. 
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/643848/3/ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/boot.py

ipa_params = deploy_utils.get_vmedia_ipa_config_params()
ramdisk_params.update(ipa_params)

Please let me know if you intended anything more than this?'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-03-23 12:04:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30100, 'date': '2019-03-23 12:14:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Adds config option to pass IPA config params to ramdisk

This commit adds new configuration parameter
'[agent]ipa_config_params' to pass IPA config parameters
during boot of IPA based ramdisk. The property 'ipa_config_params'
can be set in the node's 'driver_info' to pass IPA config options
to that node.

Change-Id: Iaa46fdf7d72487651fe779a4599300427ebbcedd
Story: #2005252
Task: #30047

Thanks, MinWook. It's better to add the video to the commit message."}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-05-12 05:04:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

One more question, MinWook. Your setting.conf should be deployed with devstack for the feature to work. It means that you should update the devstack deployment script in the vitrage repo.'}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-05-12 05:24:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31:

> Thanks, MinWook. It's better to add the video to the commit
 > message.

Hello, 

I will consider it. But I do not think it is necessary."}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-05-12 05:37:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31:

> One more question, MinWook. Your setting.conf should be deployed
 > with devstack for the feature to work. It means that you should
 > update the devstack deployment script in the vitrage repo.

Thank you for a good comment. :)

The action list panel configures setting.conf according to user's choice. Also, setting.conf does not have a default value.

If there is a required default value for setting.conf, it is correct to add it to the devstack script, but there is no default.

So if the user does not configure any action, the existence of folders and files is unnecessary.

So I do not think we need to configure setting.conf through devstack script. (Since setting.conf.sample already exists)
(+ vitrage repo -> vitrage-dashboard repo)"}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-05-13 00:38:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31:

HI MinWook. Thanks for your comments. If the setting file is provided by vitrage that's good. Just trying to get my head around the deploying procedure. I will review your patch more next week :D It's good work those."}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-05-13 08:07:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

> HI MinWook. Thanks for your comments. If the setting file is
 > provided by vitrage that's good. Just trying to get my head around
 > the deploying procedure. I will review your patch more next week :D
 > It's good work those.

Hello.

Can you tell me a specific reason, not just "good"?

Simply "good" is hard to understand.

In addition, Vitrage does not automatically configure the monitoring-related (e.g. zabbix) configuration file when installing devstack.

It depends on the user's choice. 

Therefore, I think the setting.conf file is unnecessary through devstack.

If you tell me why it is necessary, it can be a bit more discussion.

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-05-13 12:56:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31:

Hi MinWook. I think you misunderstood my words. I'm complimenting your work (for the feature), not about what I suggested."}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-05-17 05:13:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Hi Minwook,

Comments about the functionality (I did not go over the code changes):

1. The panel looks much better now :-)

2. Zabbix open works well IMO

3. Mistral Run: after the request, I'm redirected to the wrong menu. I would prefer to stay in Vitrage entity graph, and maybe have an additional tab.

4. Mistral open: can not be clicked. Is it on purpose?"}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-05-17 05:32:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Hi Minwook,
 > 
 > Comments about the functionality (I did not go over the code
 > changes):
 > 
 > 1. The panel looks much better now :-)
 > 
 > 2. Zabbix open works well IMO
 > 
 > 3. Mistral Run: after the request, I'm redirected to the wrong
 > menu. I would prefer to stay in Vitrage entity graph, and maybe
 > have an additional tab.
 > 
 > 4. Mistral open: can not be clicked. Is it on purpose?

Thanks for the comment:)

3. I'll check it again

4. This was changed according to Alon's comments.
The reason for this is that it is not necessary to open a Mistral dashboard with a new tab because Horizon already has Mistral's panel.

Did I misunderstand?

5. I'll fix it."}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-05-17 06:05:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

> > 4. Mistral open: can not be clicked. Is it on purpose?
>
 > 4. This was changed according to Alon's comments.
 > The reason for this is that it is not necessary to open a Mistral
 > dashboard with a new tab because Horizon already has Mistral's
 > panel.
 > 
 > Did I misunderstand?
 
So if you don't want to open Mistral, why have the "open" button? is it used for other action types?'}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-05-17 07:50:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

> > > 4. Mistral open: can not be clicked. Is it on purpose?
 > >
 > > 4. This was changed according to Alon's comments.
 > > The reason for this is that it is not necessary to open a Mistral
 > > dashboard with a new tab because Horizon already has Mistral's
 > > panel.
 > >
 > > Did I misunderstand?
 > 
 > So if you don't want to open Mistral, why have the "open" button?
 > is it used for other action types?

I simply wanted to maintain consistency with other actions. (Except for monitoring related actions)

Also, if you think that the button is unnecessary, it would not be a problem to change it. : )'}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-05-24 00:09:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 32.'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-06-06 10:04:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 02:19:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add action list panel for entity click action

The Vitrage Dashboard now offers several panels for Entity clicks.
Expand the functionality of these Entity Graphs to add the action
list panel as a click action on Entity. Therefore, the user can check
the available action list based on the setting file configured by the user.
In the list of actions, the user can request an external project for
the Entity, and also enter specific parameter values.

Change-Id: I5348c8b7017af45cd7e58ae0411120b6f94e49f8

commit_message:
Add action list panel for entity click action

The Vitrage Dashboard now offers several panels for Entity clicks.
Expand the functionality of these Entity Graphs to add the action
list panel as a click action on Entity. Therefore, the user can check
the available action list based on the setting file configured by the user.
In the list of actions, the user can request an external project for
the Entity, and also enter specific parameter values.

Change-Id: I5348c8b7017af45cd7e58ae0411120b6f94e49f8
Story: 2002672
Task: 22489

commit_message:
Fix reconfigure of neutron ml2_conf.ini

The neutron containers were not being restarted if only the ml2_conf.ini
file is changed. This is due to the XenAPI ml2_conf.ini config task
registering a variable of the same name as the task that generates
ml2_conf.ini for other services. Since the XenAPI service is typically
not running, the tasks show as not changed, and the handler skips
restarting the container.

This change adds a second variable for XenAPI to avoid this shadowing.

Change-Id: I77819ed8defb8a7653e1e5aec92013b1d40fbf02
Closes-Bug: #1783268
(cherry picked from commit 43c83b51cfcee320fc52218925e88d0fe1b05100)

commit_message:
DNM: Enable a Docker registry in CI

Currently only doing this in the seed job, since that is where a
registry makes most sense.

For a (future) multinode overcloud job, we may wish to deploy a registry
on one of the controllers.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/634921
Change-Id: Ib5af7ef78dcb4a05b6214ee6a105810ff2926076

commit_message:
Remove last use of rc_fields

Remove the last (except for the placement code) use of rc_fields
so that it can be safely removed in the next patch.

We can't remove it in this patch because some of the placement
code (being removed in the next patch) still uses it.

Change-Id: I6c5b584020708d13c85fa0c60aae1ee8ab8676ad

commit_message:
Fix reconfigure of neutron ml2_conf.ini

The neutron containers were not being restarted if only the ml2_conf.ini
file is changed. This is due to the XenAPI ml2_conf.ini config task
registering a variable of the same name as the task that generates
ml2_conf.ini for other services. Since the XenAPI service is typically
not running, the tasks show as not changed, and the handler skips
restarting the container.

This change adds a second variable for XenAPI to avoid this shadowing.

Change-Id: I77819ed8defb8a7653e1e5aec92013b1d40fbf02
Closes-Bug: #1783268
(cherry picked from commit 43c83b51cfcee320fc52218925e88d0fe1b05100)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I98ad21d153f2fcd0862627111fb5759f72bcc5ad
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ic1482a7dcc7e1e2aad875cf79afb2bb6d85a0248

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-23 16:05:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional regression test for bug 1669054

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to migrate, evacuate or unshelve the server
it will ignore the original source host because of the persisted
ignore_hosts value. This is obviously a problem in a small
deployment with only a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment).
As a result, an evacuation can fail if the only available host is
the one being ignored.

This adds a functional regression recreate test for the bug.

Change-Id: I6ce2d6b1baf47796f867aede1acf292ec9739d6d
Related-Bug: #1669054
'}, {'created': '2019-03-25 15:52:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional regression test for bug 1669054

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts value.
This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only a few
compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an evacuation
can fail if the only available host is the one being ignored.

This adds a functional regression recreate test for the bug.

Change-Id: I6ce2d6b1baf47796f867aede1acf292ec9739d6d
Related-Bug: #1669054
'}]
commit_message:
Add functional regression test for bug 1669054

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts value.
This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only a few
compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an evacuation
can fail if the only available host is the one being ignored.

This adds a functional regression recreate test for the bug.

Change-Id: I6ce2d6b1baf47796f867aede1acf292ec9739d6d
Related-Bug: #1669054

commit_message:
sysctl: skip application when running in container

This charm is used in containers when deploying Octavia; sysctl
can't be updated from within a LXD container, so skip the call
to apply sysctl configuration if the unit is running in a
container of any sort.

Change-Id: If3c40fa6c8b6e5448293caf726088d152f6eeee8

git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ic1517a3676b9d9ffcebfaed8b3c2747cbf84d23f

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I4bddc77206b1e8be3b9dd1206e59e8602e6006b3

commit_message:
Improve profiler logging

* The custom profiler notifier defined by Mistral now also prints
  the total elapsed time of a profiler trace into the log file .
  This makes it much easier to search for bottlenecks.

Change-Id: I1db7e66e1b3756cccfde73feee83baef9edf283f

commit_message:
Implement system reader functionality for grants

This commit opens up the assignment API for system readers and system
members to list and check grants for users and groups on projects and
domains. Subsequent patches will:

 - refactor system admin policy checks
 - implement domain reader and member support
 - implement domain admin support
 - introduce test coverage for project users and the grants API
 - remove redundant policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

Change-Id: I04bafe2f7c83addddf18591eaeba80277321139b
Related-Bug: 1805368
Related-Bug: 1750669
Related-Bug: 1806762

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-22 15:07:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix booting instances after nova-compute upgrade

After upgrading from Rocky to Stein, nova-compute services fail to start
new instances with the following error message:

Failed to allocate the network(s), not rescheduling.

Looking in the nova-compute logs, we also see this:

Neutron Reported failure on event
network-vif-plugged-60c05a0d-8758-44c9-81e4-754551567be5 for instance
32c493c4-d88c-4f14-98db-c7af64bf3324: NovaException: In shutdown, no new
events can be scheduled

During the upgrade process, we send nova containers a SIGHUP to cause
them to reload their object version state. Speaking to the nova team in
IRC, there is a known issue with this, caused by oslo.service performing
a full shutdown in response to a SIGHUP, which breaks nova-compute.
There is a patch [1] in review to address this.

The workaround employed here is to restart the nova compute service.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641907

Change-Id: Ia4fcc558a3f62ced2d629d7a22d0bc1eb6b879f1
Closes-Bug: #1821362

events can be scheduled

During the upgrade process, we send nova containers a SIGHUP to cause
them to reload their object version state. Speaking to the nova team in
IRC, there is a known issue with this, caused by oslo.service performing
a full shutdown in response to a SIGHUP, which breaks nova-compute.
There is a patch [1] in review to address this.

The workaround employed here is to restart the nova compute service.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641907

Change-Id: Ia4fcc558a3f62ced2d629d7a22d0bc1eb6b879f1
Closes-Bug: #1821362
'}]
commit_message:
Fix booting instances after nova-compute upgrade

After upgrading from Rocky to Stein, nova-compute services fail to start
new instances with the following error message:

Failed to allocate the network(s), not rescheduling.

Looking in the nova-compute logs, we also see this:

Neutron Reported failure on event
network-vif-plugged-60c05a0d-8758-44c9-81e4-754551567be5 for instance
32c493c4-d88c-4f14-98db-c7af64bf3324: NovaException: In shutdown, no new
events can be scheduled

During the upgrade process, we send nova containers a SIGHUP to cause
them to reload their object version state. Speaking to the nova team in
IRC, there is a known issue with this, caused by oslo.service performing
a full shutdown in response to a SIGHUP, which breaks nova-compute.
There is a patch [1] in review to address this.

The workaround employed here is to restart the nova compute service.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641907

Change-Id: Ia4fcc558a3f62ced2d629d7a22d0bc1eb6b879f1
Closes-Bug: #1821362

commit_message:
use neutron-lib trunk resource names

The trunk callback resource names now live in neutron-lib [1].
This patch switches over to use those constants from lib and they
will be removed from neutron in a later patch once consumers switch
over to lib as well.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635209/

Change-Id: I79dfe76c1b698fe634393e469157014f1914cc8e

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Iac99db0de5003bb52c1a10f991c0f9b468af221e

commit_message:
Make keypair name validation case insensitive

Key pair names are not case sensitive,
so need to convert the name to lowercase and make a judgement.

Closes-Bug: #1820168

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraint deps handling

When the lower-constraints tox target was added, it was assumed the
install_command was just running the install and that the dependencies
and constraints were being set using "deps = ".

This fixed the install_command and deps to follow the expected pattern
so the lower-constraints job actual does install the lower constraints.

Raising libvirt-python minimum version as the existing version would
fail.

Change-Id: Icbbae373525dce3f13fcb38373d4c66160cf05d1
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Stop creating symlinks for lbivirt's CA files

These were used in baremetal deployments, but are unused in
containerized deployments. We bind-mount the CA files instead of
creating symlinks nowadays.

Change-Id: Ib05f2bc4be9987b222cef78541fe05988cd8c0a4
Related-Bug: #1821139

subject: Add bandit for security static analysis and fix potential security issues
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:46:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:47:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:47:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

You have 3 security errors and I want to discuss with you before fixing it to try to find the best way to fix them.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-02-14 08:53:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Hervé, thank you for this. I ran bandit and had the following three issues:

* Use of exec in cloudkitty/rating/pyscripts/__init__.py. I fear this can't be fixed, as the pyscript module executes any provided python code. I think we need to add a # nosec comment to this

* Binding to all interfaces in cloudkitty/api/app.py: This option is actually not used, so it can be safely removed. Binding is either handled by the WSGI server or by pastedeply options for testing.

* Using of insecure hash function in cloudkitty/rating/pyscripts/db/sqlalchemy/models.py. The hash is only used at script creation if a user wants to validate the input. You can replace it with a sha512 or any other function available in hashlib.

Some releasenotes along with a non-voting zuul job running bandit would be very nice too! :)"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-14 09:25:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-14 09:28:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-02-14 09:28:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add bandit for security static analysis and fix potential security issues

This change adds a basic bandit config for cloudkitty. It can be invoked
by running the tox environment for bandit;
    tox -e bandit

These changes also fix potential security issues find during bandit checks.
- binding to all interface: remove useless host_ip option to avoid issue
- hash function issue: switch from sha1 to sha512
- use of exec: can't be removed for moment so using #nosec comment

Change-Id: Iae7d7604457345fe6d482cf48311c9b75fdde947

commit_message:
Changed multinode file for host image destruction.
Commented line 'localhost ansible_connection=local' under '[deployment]'
for disabling the destruction of images on deployment host
when enable_destroy_images is set.

Change-Id: I00e6ca8137b60129ef456a7c9e1b69495563a220
Closes-Bug: #1724306

commit_message:
Remove expiremental note in the VGPU docs

FWIW, we already say in the feature classification documentation that the
feature is experimental [1] but we also now have functional tests that help
to verify that the feature is working.
I think we can just remove the note about this then.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/feature-classification.html#operation_virtual_gpu

Change-Id: I705b3aeb1da33ddc41d4306ad91ad7cb70fcf4e4

[{'created': '2019-01-17 14:35:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix reconfigure of neutron ml2_conf.ini

The neutron containers were not being restarted if only the ml2_conf.ini
file is changed. This is due to the XenAPI ml2_conf.ini config task
registering a variable of the same name as the task that generates
ml2_conf.ini for other services. Since the XenAPI service is typically
not running, the tasks show as not changed, and the handler skips
restarting the container.

This change adds a second variable for XenAPI to avoid this shadowing.

Change-Id: I77819ed8defb8a7653e1e5aec92013b1d40fbf02
Closes-Bug: #1783268
'}]
commit_message:
Fix reconfigure of neutron ml2_conf.ini

The neutron containers were not being restarted if only the ml2_conf.ini
file is changed. This is due to the XenAPI ml2_conf.ini config task
registering a variable of the same name as the task that generates
ml2_conf.ini for other services. Since the XenAPI service is typically
not running, the tasks show as not changed, and the handler skips
restarting the container.

This change adds a second variable for XenAPI to avoid this shadowing.

Change-Id: I77819ed8defb8a7653e1e5aec92013b1d40fbf02
Closes-Bug: #1783268

commit_message:
Modify a detail in parse_stat

The raw stat of haproxy is such as '# x,y,z,'. It needs to be stripped
the trailing comma before split, otherwise we will get a useless
key-value pair whose value is ('','').

Story: 2001754
Task: 12152
Change-Id: Ide5643f30d1bcd8b3ff699f02b22280ac4b39823

commit_message:
Choose correct log option by listener protocol

This option has always been configured as "option tcplog". It's not
appropriate when the listener protocol is http, since the correct
configuration can display more useful information in the log of haproxy.

Story: 2001756
Task: 12154

Change-Id: I6d72e5d3f2d3ecf502df7cd4caf76a4daa4de195

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Iff8f93426925a3480cedfb899216e443b12cd826
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Iff8f93426925a3480cedfb899216e443b12cd826

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary dependencies from requirements.txt

Packages: sphinxcontrib-blockdiag and sphinxcontrib-seqdiag
are used only in docs and are already listed in docs/requirements.txt
file.
There is no need to keep them also in main requirements.

Change-Id: I1cefbadd0cc26e64dbb2204246d84c502b43b631

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-22 13:47:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix lower-constraint deps handling

When the lower-constraints tox target was added, it was assumed the
install_command was just running the install and that the dependencies
and constraints were being set using "deps = ".

This fixed the install_command and deps to follow the expected pattern
so the lower-constraints job actual does install the lower constraints.

Change-Id: I5e2eceeb874ccde90bac1a6345fcce713db1d056
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraint deps handling

When the lower-constraints tox target was added, it was assumed the
install_command was just running the install and that the dependencies
and constraints were being set using "deps = ".

This fixed the install_command and deps to follow the expected pattern
so the lower-constraints job actual does install the lower constraints.

Change-Id: I5e2eceeb874ccde90bac1a6345fcce713db1d056
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Replace URL name to the correct one in Keystone Docs

Yes,right fs030 ran against rdo-jobs correctly and this patch is solving the current issue, what about the original issue against which you proposed the original patch?'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2019-03-22 11:18:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

For sure the CI is critical, so my first rule is "don't break the CI".
Reverting the patch has been an attempt to prove that for sure my first patch has broken the ci jobs for queens+fs30. According to the bug comment (https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1817612/comments/4) my first patch wasn't critical because job passed, so before asking to have this patch merged I'll try to figure out what extra work (and what effort we need to maintain my patch without breaking your job). Do you think removing the release check could break other critical CI jobs?'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-03-26 07:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Revert patch to make broken ci job (queens fs30) working again

The stable/queens job fails due to DockerOvnControllerImage
not assigned. Reverted https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639187
to fix this issue (see https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/19588)

Closes-Bug: #1820578

Change-Id: I9631a8e13227e06f49248cc61166ee7e4ce892fd

[{'created': '2019-03-20 17:29:00.000000000', 'message': "Ensure image utils don't block greenthreads

When doing image operations in Cinder we may start getting errors on

commit_message:
Ensure image utils don't block greenthreads

When doing image operations in Cinder we may start getting errors on
RabbitMQ and DB connections, which result in the volume service
appearing as down to the scheduler.

This is caused by file I/O operations, that in some cases block
greenthreads, preventing switching to another greenthread on I/O as they
should.

This results in many different errors, so this patch makes sure that
image operations (fetch, put, verify image, ...) that could prevent
greenthread switching are executed in native threads.

NOTE(s10): Part of the change related to the image verification has not been
backported because image signature verification is only in Rocky.

Signed-off-by: Sofia Enriquez <lsofia.enriquez@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1801958
Change-Id: I8a8fbf96875319a7e5ca167fcd2bca45f57649c8
(cherry picked from commit f30f6debdc07f03b494ab136e1afe553b9fe071c)
(cherry-picked from commit e4de4fb33d3c54ee48fa2e3689e45787557ee805)
(cherry picked from commit da016c47a90d85fac1059d4abb41997696a593ea)

The following methods are overridden in DriverBlockDevice class.

* __getattr__
* __getitem__

The 'get' method is not overridden.
The value cannot be got by the 'get' method
though the value can be got by '__getattr__' (e.g. bdm.volumd_id)
or '__getitem__' (e.g. bdm['volume_id']) method.
So override the 'get' method to fix the issue.

commit_message:
Override the 'get' method in DriverBlockDevice class

The following methods are overridden in DriverBlockDevice class.

* __getattr__
* __getitem__

The 'get' method is not overridden.
The value cannot be got by the 'get' method
though the value can be got by '__getattr__' (e.g. bdm.volumd_id)
or '__getitem__' (e.g. bdm['volume_id']) method.
So override the 'get' method to fix the issue.

Change-Id: Ic665fc1956831110937d98553e526cb909e49997
Closes-Bug: #1816938

commit_message:
re add numa aware live migration for train

This change simply forward ports the spec to train
and updates the spec history footer to reflect this.

Blueprint: numa-aware-live-migration
Previously-approved: Stein

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-25 05:35:21.000000000', 'message': 'Document unset/reset wrinkle for *_allocation_ratio options

This is a follow up to I43a23a3290db0c835fed01b8d6a38962dc61adce
which makes the cpu/disk/ram_allocation_ratio config "sticky" in
that once set to a non-default value, it is not possible to reset
back to the default behavior (when config is 0.0) on an existing
compute node record by unsetting the option from nova.conf. To
reset back to the defaults, the non-0.0 default would have to be
explicitly put into config, so cpu_allocation_ratio=16.0 for example.

Alternatively operators could delete the nova-compute service
record via the DELETE /os-services/{service_id} REST API and
restart the nova-compute service to get a new compute_nodes record,
but that workaround is messy and left undocumented in config.

Change-Id: I908615d82ead0f70f8e6d2d78d5dcaed8431084d
Related-Bug: #1789654
(cherry picked from commit c45adaca5dd241408f1e29b657fe6ed42c908b8b)
(cherry picked from commit a039f8397702d15718ebcec0fdb9cfeb6155f6a1)
'}]
commit_message:
Document unset/reset wrinkle for *_allocation_ratio options

This is a follow up to I43a23a3290db0c835fed01b8d6a38962dc61adce
which makes the cpu/disk/ram_allocation_ratio config "sticky" in
that once set to a non-default value, it is not possible to reset
back to the default behavior (when config is 0.0) on an existing
compute node record by unsetting the option from nova.conf. To
reset back to the defaults, the non-0.0 default would have to be
explicitly put into config, so cpu_allocation_ratio=16.0 for example.

Alternatively operators could delete the nova-compute service
record via the DELETE /os-services/{service_id} REST API and
restart the nova-compute service to get a new compute_nodes record,
but that workaround is messy and left undocumented in config.

Change-Id: I908615d82ead0f70f8e6d2d78d5dcaed8431084d
Related-Bug: #1789654
(cherry picked from commit c45adaca5dd241408f1e29b657fe6ed42c908b8b)
(cherry picked from commit a039f8397702d15718ebcec0fdb9cfeb6155f6a1)

commit_message:
Removed the release check from the pre-deploy task.

The pre-deploy task generates the containers-prepare-parameters.yaml
file according to the selected release to deploy.
Since the create-script in the undercloud section always
create the containers-prepare-parameter.yaml file, the check
on the overcloud-deploy role is not necessary anymore.

Change-Id: Ia94faa143fe9b572bf006ec9255dcb075c075924
Closes-Bug: #1817612

As of Ocata, cinder config is preferred for rbd auth values with a
fallback to nova values [1]. The fallback path, for the case when
rbd_user is configured in cinder.conf and rbd_secret_uuid is not

with rbd_secret_uuid from nova.conf.

[1] See commit f2d27f6a8afb62815fb6a885bd4f8ae4ed287fd3

commit_message:
Ensure rbd auth fallback uses matching credentials

As of Ocata, cinder config is preferred for rbd auth values with a
fallback to nova values [1]. The fallback path, for the case when
rbd_user is configured in cinder.conf and rbd_secret_uuid is not
configured in cinder.conf, results in the mismatched use of cinder
rbd_user with nova rbd_secret_uuid.

This fixes that fallback path to use nova rbd_user from nova.conf
with rbd_secret_uuid from nova.conf.

[1] See commit f2d27f6a8afb62815fb6a885bd4f8ae4ed287fd3

Thanks to David Ames for this fix.

Change-Id: Ieba216275c07ab16414065ee47e66915e9e9477d
Co-Authored-By: David Ames <david.ames@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: #1809454
(cherry picked from commit 47b7c4f3cc582bf463fd0c796df84736a0074f48)
(cherry picked from commit f5d8ee1bfc3b7b9f1a25f85b42e207db0c9f4b04)
(cherry picked from commit accef50f9648dc40f1a6f457f83f5359e9dd2a24)
(cherry picked from commit a7e25aa3d2088e2726988c03e84b3b5ea47bfb7e)

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I651760cfa078024e03d61816a1b3acc6cd8cc01c

commit_message:
WIP : Implement system reader for grant API

This change adds tests cases for the default roles
keystone supports at install time. It also modifies
the policies for the grant API to be more self-service
by properly checking for scopes if accessed with a
system-scoped tokens. This gives system users the power
to query grants within the system they have authorization
on without exposing other grant information in the
deployment, domains, or projects.

Subsequent patches will:

- add functionality for system members
- add functionality for system admins
- add functionality for domain readers
- add functionality for domain members
- add functionality for domain admins
- add functionality for project readers
- add functionality for project members
- add functionality for project admins
- remove the obsolete policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

Change-Id: I923abbb9bd4e92a49d895e11f291e845bdb25dc5

[{'created': '2018-12-20 11:27:00.000000000', 'message': "Handle unbound vif plug errors on compute restart

As with change Ia963a093a1b26d90b4de2e8fc623031cf175aece, we can
sometimes cache failed port binding information which we'll see on
startup. Long term, the fix for both issues is to figure out how this is
being cached and stop that happening but for now we simply need to allow
the service to start up.

To this end, we copy the approach in the aforementioned change and
implement a translation function in os_vif_util for unbound which
will make the plug_vifs code raise VirtualInterfacePlugException which
is what the _init_instance code in ComputeManager is already handling.

This has the same caveats as that change, namely that there may be
smarter ways to do this that we should explore. However, that change
also included a note which goes someway to explaining this.

Conflicts:
	nova/compute/manager.py
	nova/tests/unit/network/test_os_vif_util.py

NOTE(sfinucan): As with the 'stable/ocata' backport of change
Ia963a093a1b26d90b4de2e8fc623031cf175aece, the compute manager conflicts
are due to change I2740ea14e0c4ecee0d91c7f3e401b2c29498d097 in Queens.
The _LE() marker has to be left intact for pep8 checks in Ocata. The
test_os_vif_util conflicts are due to not having change
Ic23effc05c901575f608f2b4c5ccd2b1fb3c2d5a nor change
I3f38954bc5cf7b1690182dc8af45078eea275aa4 in Ocata

Change-Id: Iaec1f6fd12dba8b11991b7a7595593d5c8b1db50
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Related-bug: #1784579
Closes-bug: #1809136
(cherry picked from commit 1def76a1c49032d93ab6c7ee61dbbfe8e29cafca)
(cherry picked from commit bc0a5d0355311641daa87b46e311ae101f1817ad)
(cherry picked from commit 79a90d37027b7ca131218e16eaee70d6d5152206)
(cherry picked from commit 7b4f5725f821ef89176ef69f036471eaaf8a6201)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle unbound vif plug errors on compute restart

As with change Ia963a093a1b26d90b4de2e8fc623031cf175aece, we can
sometimes cache failed port binding information which we'll see on
startup. Long term, the fix for both issues is to figure out how this is
being cached and stop that happening but for now we simply need to allow
the service to start up.

To this end, we copy the approach in the aforementioned change and
implement a translation function in os_vif_util for unbound which
will make the plug_vifs code raise VirtualInterfacePlugException which
is what the _init_instance code in ComputeManager is already handling.

This has the same caveats as that change, namely that there may be
smarter ways to do this that we should explore. However, that change
also included a note which goes someway to explaining this.

Conflicts:
	nova/compute/manager.py
	nova/tests/unit/network/test_os_vif_util.py

NOTE(sfinucan): As with the 'stable/ocata' backport of change
Ia963a093a1b26d90b4de2e8fc623031cf175aece, the compute manager conflicts
are due to change I2740ea14e0c4ecee0d91c7f3e401b2c29498d097 in Queens.
The _LE() marker has to be left intact for pep8 checks in Ocata. The
test_os_vif_util conflicts are due to not having change
Ic23effc05c901575f608f2b4c5ccd2b1fb3c2d5a nor change
I3f38954bc5cf7b1690182dc8af45078eea275aa4 in Ocata

Change-Id: Iaec1f6fd12dba8b11991b7a7595593d5c8b1db50
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Related-bug: #1784579
Closes-bug: #1809136
(cherry picked from commit 1def76a1c49032d93ab6c7ee61dbbfe8e29cafca)
(cherry picked from commit bc0a5d0355311641daa87b46e311ae101f1817ad)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-19 17:32:50.000000000', 'message': 'Handle binding_failed vif plug errors on compute restart

Like change Ia584dba66affb86787e3069df19bd17b89cb5c49 which
came before, is port binding fails and we have a "binding_failed"
vif type in the info cache, we'll fail to plug vifs for an
instance on compute restart which will prevent the service
from restarting. Before the os-vif conversion code, this was
handled with VirtualInterfacePlugException but the os-vif conversion
code fails in a different way by raising a generic NovaException
because the os-vif conversion utility doesn't handle a vif_type of
"binding_failed".

To resolve this and make the os-vif flow for binding_failed behave
the same as the legacy path, we implement a translation function
in os_vif_util for binding_failed which will make the plug_vifs
code raise VirtualInterfacePlugException which is what the
_init_instance code in ComputeManager is already handling.

Admittedly this isn't the smartest thing and doesn't attempt
to recover / fix the instance networking info, but it at least
gives a more clear indication of what's wrong and lets the
nova-compute service start up. A note is left in the
_init_instance error handling that we could potentially try
to heal binding_failed vifs in _heal_instance_info_cache, but
that would need to be done in a separate change since it's more
invasive.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py
      nova/tests/unit/network/test_os_vif_util.py

NOTE(mriedem): The compute manager conflicts are due to change
I2740ea14e0c4ecee0d91c7f3e401b2c29498d097 in Queens. The _LE()
marker has to be left intact for pep8 checks in Ocata. The
test_os_vif_util conflicts are due to not having change
Ic23effc05c901575f608f2b4c5ccd2b1fb3c2d5a nor change
I3f38954bc5cf7b1690182dc8af45078eea275aa4 in Ocata.

Change-Id: Ia963a093a1b26d90b4de2e8fc623031cf175aece
Closes-Bug: #1784579
(cherry picked from commit cdf8ba5acb7f65042af9c21fcbe1a126bd857ad0)
(cherry picked from commit a890e3d624a84d8eb0306fab580e2cec33e26bc3)
(cherry picked from commit 4827cedbc56033c2ac3caf0d7998fca6aff997d6)
(cherry picked from commit 254a19f0d326ae5d3b5890d0d5fc735a771fcc0b)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle binding_failed vif plug errors on compute restart

Like change Ia584dba66affb86787e3069df19bd17b89cb5c49 which
came before, is port binding fails and we have a "binding_failed"
vif type in the info cache, we'll fail to plug vifs for an
instance on compute restart which will prevent the service
from restarting. Before the os-vif conversion code, this was
handled with VirtualInterfacePlugException but the os-vif conversion
code fails in a different way by raising a generic NovaException
because the os-vif conversion utility doesn't handle a vif_type of
"binding_failed".

To resolve this and make the os-vif flow for binding_failed behave
the same as the legacy path, we implement a translation function
in os_vif_util for binding_failed which will make the plug_vifs
code raise VirtualInterfacePlugException which is what the
_init_instance code in ComputeManager is already handling.

Admittedly this isn't the smartest thing and doesn't attempt
to recover / fix the instance networking info, but it at least
gives a more clear indication of what's wrong and lets the
nova-compute service start up. A note is left in the
_init_instance error handling that we could potentially try
to heal binding_failed vifs in _heal_instance_info_cache, but
that would need to be done in a separate change since it's more
invasive.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py
      nova/tests/unit/network/test_os_vif_util.py

NOTE(mriedem): The compute manager conflicts are due to change
I2740ea14e0c4ecee0d91c7f3e401b2c29498d097 in Queens. The _LE()
marker has to be left intact for pep8 checks in Ocata. The
test_os_vif_util conflicts are due to not having change
Ic23effc05c901575f608f2b4c5ccd2b1fb3c2d5a nor change
I3f38954bc5cf7b1690182dc8af45078eea275aa4 in Ocata.

Change-Id: Ia963a093a1b26d90b4de2e8fc623031cf175aece
Closes-Bug: #1784579
(cherry picked from commit cdf8ba5acb7f65042af9c21fcbe1a126bd857ad0)
(cherry picked from commit a890e3d624a84d8eb0306fab580e2cec33e26bc3)
(cherry picked from commit 4827cedbc56033c2ac3caf0d7998fca6aff997d6)
(cherry picked from commit 254a19f0d326ae5d3b5890d0d5fc735a771fcc0b)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I6109bff3227f87d914abf7bd1d76143aaf91419d
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Remove assignment policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

By incorporating system-scope and default roles, we've
effectively made these policies obsolete. We can simplify
what we maintain and provide a more consistent, unified
view of default service behavior by removing them.

This commit also removes some redundant tests in test_v3_protection
or corrects them.

Partial-Bug: 1806762
Change-Id: I008aed9c01b9e834a197444ff2dc1f6eb1ba25b1

This commit adds some scaffolding for testing how user with project
role assignments should behave with the role assignment API.

commit_message:
Use Selection object to fill request group mapping

To fill the request group - resource provider mapping nova needs to look
at the allocation that is made in placement as well as the traits of
the used providers. So far these were explicit placement calls. However
it turns out that the Selection object already contains the allocation
data so one of the extra placement calls can be removed.

This patch replaces the GET /allocations/<uuid> placement call from
conductor build instance codepath with the usage of the
Selection.allocation_request json blob.

Closes-Bug: #1819430

Change-Id: Iecbee518444bd282ce5f6fd019db41a322f76a83

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-18 14:40:59.000000000', 'message': 'Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie2488e30896db1277b6f56d0122d84cc5e7e05f1
'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie2488e30896db1277b6f56d0122d84cc5e7e05f1

commit_message:
Add mising handlers for external Ceph.

When Nova, Glance, or Cinder are deployed alongside an external Ceph deployment
handlers will fail to trigger if keyring files are updated, which results in the
containers not being restarted.

This change adds the missing 'when' conditions for nova-libvirt, nova-compute,
cinder-volume, cinder-backup, and glance-api containers.

Change-Id: I8e183aac9a72e7a7210f7edc7cdcbaedd4fbcaa9

commit_message:
Bring back the --serial flag alive

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/
openstack-ansible-os_tempest/tree/tasks/tempest_run.yml#n24
Syntex is correct, but --serial flag was not getting exposed in
rocky/master os_tempest tempest_run playbook, It refactors
the shell script and nicer so that it works perfectly.

Change-Id: Ieca5103f803778a44bbb517954b56a9069babbdd
(cherry picked from commit 8794a6641bb466ceb5395935d169e85b698a034f)

This change adds a new exporter image, the blackbox
exporter from the prometheus project [0] that allows
external monitoring of resources.

[0] https://github.com/prometheus/blackbox_exporter

Signed-off-by: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@linaro.org>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-08 18:24:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add neutron-rootwrap-daemon to neutron_sudoers

There is no way to use neutron-rootwrap-daemon to improve Neutron
rootwrap performance at scale with the current Neutron images.

Using neutron-rootwrap on huge environment could have a performance
impact on many actions and be the root cause of failure during
instance creation.

Operators should have the choice:
  - neutron-rootwrap
  - neutron-rootwrap-daemon

Change-Id: I6c65cf6498364e670cc61419dc3a2c19f6fb412d
Closes-Bug: #1808457
(cherry picked from commit 4ed611a0bde7b44cb1a9c3c355c7f7a72e9afc94)
'}]
commit_message:
Add neutron-rootwrap-daemon to neutron_sudoers

There is no way to use neutron-rootwrap-daemon to improve Neutron
rootwrap performance at scale with the current Neutron images.

Using neutron-rootwrap on huge environment could have a performance
impact on many actions and be the root cause of failure during
instance creation.

Operators should have the choice:
  - neutron-rootwrap
  - neutron-rootwrap-daemon

Change-Id: I6c65cf6498364e670cc61419dc3a2c19f6fb412d
Closes-Bug: #1808457
(cherry picked from commit 4ed611a0bde7b44cb1a9c3c355c7f7a72e9afc94)

I24d730a1e0c46cc292923aceb8bae8d0856b6798 should have been held until the requirements repo created the stable/stein branch.  Merging before that means that testing for stein is unconstrained (due to the constraints url 404'ing).

Fortunately we recently landed work in the release repo to fix that race. commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I30164f3bc28cfa49edad96d17e0f26622bd6c054

messages: [{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-03-25 03:18:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-03-25 03:19:02.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from legacy-job-bionic-stable/stein to legacy-job-bionic'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2019-03-25 07:40:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2019-03-26 03:42:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13111, 'date': '2019-03-26 04:12:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-25 03:18:55.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate legacy jobs to Ubuntu Bionic

We have migrated the zuulv3 job to Bionic during Dec/Jan month.
 - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000837.html
 - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
But that effort does not move all gate job to Bionic as there are
large amount of jobs are still legacy jobs. All the legacy jobs still
use Xenial as nodeset.

As per the decided runtime for Stein, we need to test everything on openstack
CI/CD on Bionic - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html

Below patch move the legacy base jobs to bionic which will move the derived jobs
automatically to bionic. These jobs are modified with branch variant so that they will use
Bionic node from stein onwards and xenial for all other stable branches
until stable/rocky.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096

This commit remove the overridden nodeset from legacy jobs
so that it will start using the nodeset defined in parent job.

More Details: 
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/legacy-job-bionic
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003614.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096
Change-Id: I99646904d3d0fb26f4e45df1be841a67c4c2477b
(cherry picked from commit a4865b64f649a0232ed1e6b9a7f44cced8b0c726)
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate legacy jobs to Ubuntu Bionic

We have migrated the zuulv3 job to Bionic during Dec/Jan month.
 - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000837.html
 - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
But that effort does not move all gate job to Bionic as there are
large amount of jobs are still legacy jobs. All the legacy jobs still
use Xenial as nodeset.

As per the decided runtime for Stein, we need to test everything on openstack
CI/CD on Bionic - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html

Below patch move the legacy base jobs to bionic which will move the derived jobs
automatically to bionic. These jobs are modified with branch variant so that they will use
Bionic node from stein onwards and xenial for all other stable branches
until stable/rocky.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096

This commit remove the overridden nodeset from legacy jobs
so that it will start using the nodeset defined in parent job.

More Details: 
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/legacy-job-bionic
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003614.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096
Change-Id: I99646904d3d0fb26f4e45df1be841a67c4c2477b
(cherry picked from commit a4865b64f649a0232ed1e6b9a7f44cced8b0c726)

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I595d2589e375b006d629885c56794bb25082a483

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I93cdf1b1c883815a00c30811b4b4b8ec89442aab

My understanding is you're trying to backport the fixes for:

I8a705114d47384fcd00955d4a4f204072fed57c2

But that introduced a bug:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1744079

Which was then fixed with:

Iec50269ef31dfe090f0cd4db95a37909661bd910

So you're trying to squash them together so we don't just backport the former (which introduces a bug) without also including the latter.

You couldn't propose the backports for the former because they have already been proposed and abandoned, and you can't restore them because you're not (1) the owner of the change or (2) on the core team for nova stable branches.

I would prefer to backport the changes in order without squashing them since that makes reviewing the backports easier. I can restore the backports from Stephen if you (Zhang Hua) would like to take them over and then backport Iec50269ef31dfe090f0cd4db95a37909661bd910 on top so they are in a series in both stable/pike and stable/ocata.

We can ensure the fixes are merged together without squashing by only approving the first backport when the second is approved."}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2019-01-25 03:09:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2019-01-25 03:31:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-17 02:22:47.000000000', 'message': "Fix disk size during live migration with disk over-commit

Prior to microversion 2.25, the migration api supported a
'disk_over_commit' parameter, which indicated that we should do disk
size check on the destination host taking into account disk
over-commit. Versions since 2.25 no longer have this parameter, but we
continue to support the older microversion.

This disk size check was broken when disk over commit was in use on
the host. In LibvirtDriver._assert_dest_node_has_enough_disk() we
correctly calculate the required space using allocated disk size
rather than virtual disk size when doing an over-committed check.
However, we were checking against 'disk_available_least' as reported
by the destination host. This value is: the amount of disk space which
the host would have if all instances fully allocated their storage. On
an over-committed host it will therefore be negative, despite there
actually being space on the destination host.

The check we actually want to do for disk over commit is: does the
target host have enough free space to take the allocated size of this
instance's disks? We leave checking over-allocation ratios to the
scheduler. Note that if we use disk_available_least here and the
destination host is over-allocated, this will always fail because free
space will be negative, even though we're explicitly ok with that.

Using disk_available_least would make sense for the non-overcommit
case, where the test would be: would the target host have enough free
space for this instance if the instance fully allocated all its
storage, and everything else on the target also fully allocated its
storage? As noted, we no longer actually run that test, though.

We fix the issue for legacy microversions by fixing the destination
host's reported disk space according to the given disk_over_commit
parameter.

Change-Id: I8a705114d47384fcd00955d4a4f204072fed57c2
Resolves-bug: #1708572
(cherry picked from commit e097c001c8e11110efe8879da57264fcb7bdfdf2)
Signed-off-by: Zhang Hua <joshua.zhang@canonical.com>

Refix disk size during live migration with disk over-commit

Currently available disk of targer host is calculated based on
local_gb, not available disk(free_disk_gb). This check can be
negative if the target host has no free disk.

Change-Id: Iec50269ef31dfe090f0cd4db95a37909661bd910
closes-bug: 1744079
(cherry picked from commit e2cc275063658b23ed88824100919a6dfccb760d)
Signed-off-by: Zhang Hua <joshua.zhang@canonical.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-01-25 03:09:34.000000000', 'message': 'Refix disk size during live migration with disk over-commit

Currently available disk of targer host is calculated based on
local_gb, not available disk(free_disk_gb). This check can be

Change-Id: Iec50269ef31dfe090f0cd4db95a37909661bd910

(cherry picked from commit e2cc275063658b23ed88824100919a6dfccb760d)

commit_message:
Refix disk size during live migration with disk over-commit

Currently available disk of targer host is calculated based on
local_gb, not available disk(free_disk_gb). This check can be
negative if the target host has no free disk.

Change-Id: Iec50269ef31dfe090f0cd4db95a37909661bd910
closes-bug: 1744079
(cherry picked from commit e2cc275063658b23ed88824100919a6dfccb760d)
Signed-off-by: Zhang Hua <joshua.zhang@canonical.com>

I remember the bug, and I have a bit of context. I think the change itself is fine given it just fixes the stable API version (like if you're using OSC). I just need to consider a bit more about the impact of a backport here (because two nodes could have different behaviours based on whether you applied the patch or not) before approving that change."}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2018-02-01 09:55:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-02 13:53:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix disk size during live migration with disk over-commit

Prior to microversion 2.25, the migration api supported a
'disk_over_commit' parameter, which indicated that we should do disk
size check on the destination host taking into account disk
over-commit. Versions since 2.25 no longer have this parameter, but we
continue to support the older microversion.

This disk size check was broken when disk over commit was in use on
the host. In LibvirtDriver._assert_dest_node_has_enough_disk() we
correctly calculate the required space using allocated disk size
rather than virtual disk size when doing an over-committed check.
However, we were checking against 'disk_available_least' as reported
by the destination host. This value is: the amount of disk space which
the host would have if all instances fully allocated their storage. On
an over-committed host it will therefore be negative, despite there
actually being space on the destination host.

The check we actually want to do for disk over commit is: does the
target host have enough free space to take the allocated size of this
instance's disks? We leave checking over-allocation ratios to the
scheduler. Note that if we use disk_available_least here and the
destination host is over-allocated, this will always fail because free
space will be negative, even though we're explicitly ok with that.

Using disk_available_least would make sense for the non-overcommit
case, where the test would be: would the target host have enough free
space for this instance if the instance fully allocated all its
storage, and everything else on the target also fully allocated its
storage? As noted, we no longer actually run that test, though.

We fix the issue for legacy microversions by fixing the destination
host's reported disk space according to the given disk_over_commit
parameter.

Change-Id: I8a705114d47384fcd00955d4a4f204072fed57c2
Resolves-bug: #1708572
(cherry picked from commit e097c001c8e11110efe8879da57264fcb7bdfdf2)

actually being space on the destination host.

The check we actually want to do for disk over commit is: does the

destination host is over-allocated, this will always fail because free
space will be negative, even though we're explicitly ok with that.

Using disk_available_least would make sense for the non-overcommit
case, where the test would be: would the target host have enough free
space for this instance if the instance fully allocated all its
storage, and everything else on the target also fully allocated its
storage? As noted, we no longer actually run that test, though.

We fix the issue for legacy microversions by fixing the destination

commit_message:
Fix disk size during live migration with disk over-commit

Prior to microversion 2.25, the migration api supported a
'disk_over_commit' parameter, which indicated that we should do disk
size check on the destination host taking into account disk
over-commit. Versions since 2.25 no longer have this parameter, but we
continue to support the older microversion.

This disk size check was broken when disk over commit was in use on
the host. In LibvirtDriver._assert_dest_node_has_enough_disk() we
correctly calculate the required space using allocated disk size
rather than virtual disk size when doing an over-committed check.
However, we were checking against 'disk_available_least' as reported
by the destination host. This value is: the amount of disk space which
the host would have if all instances fully allocated their storage. On
an over-committed host it will therefore be negative, despite there
actually being space on the destination host.

The check we actually want to do for disk over commit is: does the
target host have enough free space to take the allocated size of this
instance's disks? We leave checking over-allocation ratios to the
scheduler. Note that if we use disk_available_least here and the
destination host is over-allocated, this will always fail because free
space will be negative, even though we're explicitly ok with that.

Using disk_available_least would make sense for the non-overcommit
case, where the test would be: would the target host have enough free
space for this instance if the instance fully allocated all its
storage, and everything else on the target also fully allocated its
storage? As noted, we no longer actually run that test, though.

We fix the issue for legacy microversions by fixing the destination
host's reported disk space according to the given disk_over_commit
parameter.

Change-Id: I8a705114d47384fcd00955d4a4f204072fed57c2
Resolves-bug: #1708572
(cherry picked from commit e097c001c8e11110efe8879da57264fcb7bdfdf2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-19 23:29:09.000000000', 'message': "Update port device_owner when unshelving

When we shelve offload an instance, we unplug VIFs, delete
the guest from the compute host, etc. The instance is still
logically attached to its ports but they aren't connected
on any host.

When we unshelve an instance, it is scheduled and created
on a potentially new host, in a potentially new availability
zone. During unshelve, the compute manager will call the
setup_instance_network_on_host() method to update the port
host binding information for the new host, but was not
updating the device_owner, which reflects the availability
zone that the instance is in. Because of this, an instance
can be created in az1, shelved, and then unshelved in az2
but the port device_owner still says az1 even though the
port host binding is for a compute host in az2.

This change simply updates the port device_owner when
updating the port binding host during unshelve.

A TODO is left in the cleanup_instance_network_on_host()
method which is called during shelve offload but is currently
not implemented. We should unbind ports when shelve offloading,
but that is a bit of a bigger change and left for a separate
patch since it is not technically needed for this bug fix.

Change-Id: Ibd1cbe0e9b5cf3ede542dbf62b1a7d503ba7ea06
Closes-Bug: #1759924
(cherry picked from commit 93802619adde69bf84d26d7231480abb4da07c91)
(cherry picked from commit 3e38d1cf16ca29948be499aa37e2494ffd001f12)
(cherry picked from commit 245364ece1689853bf33ac25d7319618d064d909)
"}]
commit_message:
Update port device_owner when unshelving

When we shelve offload an instance, we unplug VIFs, delete
the guest from the compute host, etc. The instance is still
logically attached to its ports but they aren't connected
on any host.

When we unshelve an instance, it is scheduled and created
on a potentially new host, in a potentially new availability
zone. During unshelve, the compute manager will call the
setup_instance_network_on_host() method to update the port
host binding information for the new host, but was not
updating the device_owner, which reflects the availability
zone that the instance is in. Because of this, an instance
can be created in az1, shelved, and then unshelved in az2
but the port device_owner still says az1 even though the
port host binding is for a compute host in az2.

This change simply updates the port device_owner when
updating the port binding host during unshelve.

A TODO is left in the cleanup_instance_network_on_host()
method which is called during shelve offload but is currently
not implemented. We should unbind ports when shelve offloading,
but that is a bit of a bigger change and left for a separate
patch since it is not technically needed for this bug fix.

Change-Id: Ibd1cbe0e9b5cf3ede542dbf62b1a7d503ba7ea06
Closes-Bug: #1759924
(cherry picked from commit 93802619adde69bf84d26d7231480abb4da07c91)
(cherry picked from commit 3e38d1cf16ca29948be499aa37e2494ffd001f12)
(cherry picked from commit 245364ece1689853bf33ac25d7319618d064d909)

commit_message:
Correct examples in "Manage Compute services" documentation

* "compute service set" command requires a host, not a zone
* the --disable-reason flag's argument has to be quoted

(cherry picked from commit be221ecb0f6d09980052abfd867633a47b42e83e)

[{'created': '2018-07-11 19:17:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix server_group_members quota check

For example there are 3 instances in a server group (quota is 5).
When doing multi-creating of 3 more instances in this group
(would have 6 members), current quota checking scheme will fail to
prevent this happening, which is not expected.

This is due to the server_group_members quota check previously
only counting group members that existed as instance records in
cell databases and not accounting for build requests which are
the temporary representation of the instance in the API database
before the instance is scheduled to a cell.

'}]
commit_message:
Fix server_group_members quota check

For example there are 3 instances in a server group (quota is 5).
When doing multi-creating of 3 more instances in this group
(would have 6 members), current quota checking scheme will fail to
prevent this happening, which is not expected.

This is due to the server_group_members quota check previously
only counting group members that existed as instance records in
cell databases and not accounting for build requests which are
the temporary representation of the instance in the API database
before the instance is scheduled to a cell.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: If439f4486b8fe157c436c47aa408608e639a3e15
Closes-Bug: #1780373
(cherry picked from commit bbee9a26a5c64a1463bd9a9f82d735ec17c62d52)
(cherry picked from commit 1aa81ebfdc585451cbae9c9bbde8adfe339cb0dc)
