[{'created': '2019-03-24 21:07:40.000000000', 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: If60c8b3809ee5ffeccaae97f5a2203eae2c6a1e6
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: If60c8b3809ee5ffeccaae97f5a2203eae2c6a1e6

[{'created': '2018-07-24 14:34:02.000000000', 'message': 'Do not install linux-image-extra by default

In Ubuntu 14.04, the kernel shipped was lightweight, and some
extra features like using vhost_net, required the package
linux-image-extra.

In Ubuntu 16.04 and above, this is not the case anymore,
as many kernel packages ship with extra features.

vhost_net is generally shipped with the kernel package nowadays
and was the only one documented for the addition of the
linux-image-extra into our roles.

Change-Id: I70fa446c2dd00e12702280388299d189e0f3e5c4

commit_message:
Do not install linux-image-extra by default

In Ubuntu 14.04, the kernel shipped was lightweight, and some
extra features like using vhost_net, required the package
linux-image-extra.

In Ubuntu 16.04 and above, this is not the case anymore,
as many kernel packages ship with extra features.

vhost_net is generally shipped with the kernel package nowadays
and was the only one documented for the addition of the
linux-image-extra into our roles.

Change-Id: I70fa446c2dd00e12702280388299d189e0f3e5c4
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585376/
Closes-Bug: 1783342

commit_message:
oslo.db 4.45.0

This is a necessary feature release off the stein branch because our
previous lower-constraint on psycopg2 does not work with postgresql 10,
which is now used in Ubuntu Bionic. The only change in this release
is to bump the minimum version of psycopg2 to one that does work
with postgresql 10.

Change-Id: I8d63fd0de8159b561314753d01e37384d73d58f3
Related-Bug: 1821400

messages:
[{'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-02-14 14:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-02-14 15:34:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks James.

Btw: I created an RFE https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1815918
Creating actual neutron ports is a potentially better fix imo. It would give DeployedServer the benefit of hosts_routes added by neutron on L3 routed networks, and mtu etc. would be what the user put in undercloud.conf.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-02-27 10:45:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-03-25 13:57:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-14 14:53:41.000000000', 'message': 'Default ControlPlaneMtu to 1500

As a follow up to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635622/, this also
defaults the value for mtu to 1500 when using DeployedServerPortMap.

Previously, the value was getting set to "0" since it did not get set in
the output. While the "0" value showed up in
/etc/os-net-config/config.json, it didn't actually break anything since
os-net-config has code that only set MTU with "if interface.mtu ...",
and 0 evaluated to False, so it assumed it wasn't set.

With this patch the value will be properly defaulted to 1500 though.

Change-Id: I12d110d653a77bef87d06b4713704844a46b065d
'}]
commit_message:
Default ControlPlaneMtu to 1500

As a follow up to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635622/, this also
defaults the value for mtu to 1500 when using DeployedServerPortMap.

Previously, the value was getting set to "0" since it did not get set in
the output. While the "0" value showed up in
/etc/os-net-config/config.json, it didn't actually break anything since
os-net-config has code that only set MTU with "if interface.mtu ...",
and 0 evaluated to False, so it assumed it wasn't set.

With this patch the value will be properly defaulted to 1500 though.

Change-Id: I12d110d653a77bef87d06b4713704844a46b065d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-19 20:18:43.000000000', 'message': 'Remove timeout from ansible-playbook-command.sh

Switches the prepending of "timeout <value>" to the ansible-playbook
command until after ansible-playbook-command.sh has been written.

There's no need to write the command to the reprodcuer script with the
timeout command as well, as it creates for a poor experience when using
the script (can't Ctrl-C, etc).

Change-Id: I2e002cd0bfc9fe1f3c0a70b80c40f4728d7c1785
'}]
commit_message:
Remove timeout from ansible-playbook-command.sh

Switches the prepending of "timeout <value>" to the ansible-playbook
command until after ansible-playbook-command.sh has been written.

There's no need to write the command to the reprodcuer script with the
timeout command as well, as it creates for a poor experience when using
the script (can't Ctrl-C, etc).

Change-Id: I2e002cd0bfc9fe1f3c0a70b80c40f4728d7c1785

commit_message:
Don't customize image before upload it to Glance by default

Commit [1] provided new possibility to customize e.g. Ubuntu
image and e.g. install some additional packages just before
upload it to Glance in Devstack's stack.sh script.
It was done to be able to install e.g. socat package to test
multicast.
But until now we don't have tests which would use this and
this customization causes sometimes job failures when
there is package and index mismatch.

So there is no need to customize image always by default.
If we will need to use this customization, we should use
OpenStack's infra mirrors of Ubuntu repositories and then
enable this option for job where its needed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573702/

Change-Id: Ie84c0ae56dbd42cd522c4258903b7eafb435004f
Closes-Bug: #1821384

commit_message:
Update system grant policies for system member

This commit ensures users with the ``member`` role on the system can
perform read-only operations against the system assignment API.

 - system admin functionality
 - domain user test coverage
 - project user test coverage

Change-Id: I834475da2343ba87fb169689f71d4cb4713f6786
Related-Bug: 1805368
Related-Bug: 1750669
Related-Bug: 1806762

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I669e77c1cc1d626552939b8f65e093e7901ad754

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-22 03:24:14.000000000', 'message': "Stop running tempest-multinode-full

The job was added to nova with change:

  05ab017907376cc262887104556b01fee18db0c2

As I explained in the mailing list [1], we should
have sufficient test coverage in other voting jobs
that run against nova changes with the use of the
tempest-full-py3, tempest-slow-py3, nova-next, and
nova-(grenade)live-migration jobs. The tempest-full
and nova-next jobs are single-node jobs which run
compute API tests and some scenario tests but no
slow tests and no live migration. The tempest-slow
job is multinode and only runs slow tests. The
live migration jobs run live migration tests over
two nodes (and nova-live-migration also runs
evacuate tests). So tempest-multinode-full is
probably mostly redundant, a waste of time and
resources, especially since it's non-voting.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/004139.html

Change-Id: Id2f748d4b119002292bda45689472a68254079ee
"}]
commit_message:
Stop running tempest-multinode-full

The job was added to nova with change:

  05ab017907376cc262887104556b01fee18db0c2

As I explained in the mailing list [1], we should
have sufficient test coverage in other voting jobs
that run against nova changes with the use of the
tempest-full-py3, tempest-slow-py3, nova-next, and
nova-(grenade)live-migration jobs. The tempest-full
and nova-next jobs are single-node jobs which run
compute API tests and some scenario tests but no
slow tests and no live migration. The tempest-slow
job is multinode and only runs slow tests. The
live migration jobs run live migration tests over
two nodes (and nova-live-migration also runs
evacuate tests). So tempest-multinode-full is
probably mostly redundant, a waste of time and
resources, especially since it's non-voting.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/004139.html

Change-Id: Id2f748d4b119002292bda45689472a68254079ee

commit_message:
Mark unacknowledged RC releases as forced

This updates the storlets and mistral RC1 releases to be flagged as
"forced" since we did not get a response from the current or incoming
PTLs.

Change-Id: I1b8490860043710958e776684270b4fd0cc03cf0

(6 comments)

I'm still not convinced of the value of this in its current form. More specific reasons inline.

That said, looking at some of the examples in the projects you listed, I do see some logic that we could factor out and allow people to use without duplicating code all over the place. Solum in particular already has a yamlutils module[1] and I think we could implement their CSafe vs. Safe logic. I'm assuming they do that for performance purposes, so it seems like a valid reason to have common code around YAML handling. Heat has similar logic as well.

reimplement theirs own yaml parser for loading and dumping.

commit_message:
Introduce a base yaml parser for all openstack components

A lot of openstack components like:
- solum
- tosca-parser
- heat
- murano
- etc...

reimplement theirs own yaml parser for loading and dumping.

These implementations sometimes forgot to use a safe loader
or safe dumper, our implementation use safe by default.

You can deactive safe by passing the argument is_safe to false when
you call oslo_serialization.yamlutils.load or oslo_serialization.yamlutils.dump.

Change-Id: I63e85a2b4fc999e6acac12ae51c2ab8c64bddbc6
Co-Authored-By: Natal Ngétal <hobbestigrou@erakis.eu>

commit_message:
Include openstack/cinderlib in PROJECTS

The openstack/cinderlib repository will be used by third party Cinder
drivers' jobs to run cinderlib functional tests together with tempest
tests.

This adds a conditional based on the branch to include the
openstack/cinderlib repo in the default PROJECTS list on Stein and later
releases.

Change-Id: I41c08164fab4bab81271741c3355ae6c08e67a8d

commit_message:
Add missing TLS configuration for ironic

Conflicts:
	docker/services/ironic-api.yaml

Differs from Pike since Queens has an explicit step for
online_data_migrations that needs updating.

Change-Id: Ibc23a450a6d874305ae45331b4bcf4f5936c155a
Closes-Bug: #1820815
(cherry picked from commit 214e8448a1c1f1f5f069ffebccbabb7e03241b61)

commit_message:
Add cinderlib functional tests to LVM job

This patch adds cinderlib functional tests to the
"cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican" job as a post run playbook that
can fail without affecting the job's result.

In the future we may want to add an independent voting job, but for the
time being this approach means that we limit the load on our gate jobs,
as running the functional test on an already deployed system takes less
than a minute, whereas doing a full deployment takes longer.

The cinderlib functional tests are getting their storage configuration
from the existing /etc/cinder/cinder.conf file.

Change-Id: I7d877e2e18288a42fbfbc57b49a4294a2a98b713

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I258601b7d6888299dca1aa238b4049252ee0c317

messages:
[{'account_id': 30144, 'date': '2019-03-20 22:33:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-03-20 22:33:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-03-21 17:55:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks for your first contribution!'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-03-25 14:55:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-20 22:33:39.000000000', 'message': "Don't use proc in title patterns

Using a proc in type title patterns causes an error when generating
puppet types for environment isolation. For example, running `puppet
generate types` on a puppet master produces the following error:
```
Error:
/etc/puppetlabs/code/environments/production/modules/keystone/lib/puppet/type/keystone_user_role.rb:
title patterns that use procs are not supported.
```

This commit changes the `project_domain` parameter to always default to
`DEFAULT_DOMAIN` even when using a `<user>::<user_domain>@::<domain>` or
`<user>@::<domain>` title pattern. The only place I could find that
utilized `project_domain` being unset was determining `keystone_domain`
autorequires. The logic was updated to reflect that `project_domain` is
either set or should use the default unless `domain` is set.

Change-Id: Icd29c5aa89ae442ca69cad0411188162462bf6ff
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use proc in title patterns

Using a proc in type title patterns causes an error when generating
puppet types for environment isolation. For example, running `puppet
generate types` on a puppet master produces the following error:
```
Error:
/etc/puppetlabs/code/environments/production/modules/keystone/lib/puppet/type/keystone_user_role.rb:
title patterns that use procs are not supported.
```

This commit changes the `project_domain` parameter to always default to
`DEFAULT_DOMAIN` even when using a `<user>::<user_domain>@::<domain>` or
`<user>@::<domain>` title pattern. The only place I could find that
utilized `project_domain` being unset was determining `keystone_domain`
autorequires. The logic was updated to reflect that `project_domain` is
either set or should use the default unless `domain` is set.

Change-Id: Icd29c5aa89ae442ca69cad0411188162462bf6ff

which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I9b1c36da52a61ea9a0504e6d6c3f2efb915529f5

commit_message:
Handling unexpected python error "NoneType object is not iterable"

The glance documentation states that None (empty image) is a valid
return value. We have to handle this outcome. Adding error handling
helps debugging this unhandled issue

Change-Id: If7c22ac4516f8c2a6ccd8bf6b6ed98409312b138
Closes-Bug: #1798147
(cherry picked from commit d3afc39467c6532344118e8e491409878da9c2dd)
(cherry picked from commit 805368e902ada4c63e2e6e4d6692cf8cc2531a1e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-19 11:31:38.000000000', 'message': 'Run chown for nova log files on every run to fix wrong permissions

If nova-manage command was triggered on a host for the first time as root
(usually manual runs) the nova-manage.log gets created as root user. On
overcloud deploy runs the nova-manage command is run as nova user. In such
situation the overcloud deploy fails as the nova user can not write to the
nova-manage.log. With this change we run the chown of the logs files on
every overcloud deploy to fix the nova-manage.log file permissions.

Closes-Bug: #1820590

Change-Id: Iaa8db09712da6c0d9553fab39d7d5b50fa7cf287
(cherry picked from commit c62247fa8b9ed0ebbe01b8751d2ca45d66220084)
(cherry picked from commit 85885cbcfa9e83dc22cadc7785479aa4fecddd44)
'}]
commit_message:
Run chown for nova log files on every run to fix wrong permissions

If nova-manage command was triggered on a host for the first time as root
(usually manual runs) the nova-manage.log gets created as root user. On
overcloud deploy runs the nova-manage command is run as nova user. In such
situation the overcloud deploy fails as the nova user can not write to the
nova-manage.log. With this change we run the chown of the logs files on
every overcloud deploy to fix the nova-manage.log file permissions.

Closes-Bug: #1820590

Change-Id: Iaa8db09712da6c0d9553fab39d7d5b50fa7cf287
(cherry picked from commit c62247fa8b9ed0ebbe01b8751d2ca45d66220084)
(cherry picked from commit 85885cbcfa9e83dc22cadc7785479aa4fecddd44)

commit_message:
Fix running the baremetal provide workflow with node names

Currently we try to pass the same input to the cells v2 discovery
workflow, but it only accepts node UUIDs. Convert names to UUIDs
before calling it.

Change-Id: I09d4104b42e858cf49242b191cd1aec17f9a8b8a
Closes-Bug: #1818541
(cherry picked from commit 03454b89a1451a3e6c2930a2f9217efb26cddea0)

commit_message:
Clean up node registration output.

The cell_v2_discover_hosts is an internal workflow
and doesn't need to send messages. It is retried by
the parent workflow as it is expected to fail, and
when it does we don't want it to send error messages
each time. which can be retried up to 30 times by
the parent workflow.

Conflicts:
	workbooks/baremetal.yaml

Change-Id: I4b8f8d153a8e8c2eabb9efadb52cf685e1f3759f
Closes-Bug: #1710685
(cherry picked from commit 206dd5ddabdec5eefb9ed9e2efddaaea67fa14b5)

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I5c3374bc109471686712d0880f438dcc499f0f49

commit_message:
Remove ENV parameters for nova_cell_v2_discover_host.py

With [1] nova_cell_v2_discover_host.py was reworked to get env
details from nova.conf. Therefore we do not need to pass the ENV
vars.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/633230

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/639929
Change-Id: Ifff3646bc8fb70c12859e99c4954653369cb4dae
(cherry picked from commit 8aff2f70f52098b8daeedcbd0d2748b4e28ac230)

commit_message:
Install tmpwatch in the overcloud base image

This will allow to properly clean files and logs without having to
use logrotate "postrotate" script.

Change-Id: I53d0d3f4bc16a9bbc33395b918436dbb652fb1b4
(cherry picked from commit bd0b986e88e80cb9bbe5090f21b98a79119b6a30)

commit_message:
Fix running the baremetal provide workflow with node names

Currently we try to pass the same input to the cells v2 discovery
workflow, but it only accepts node UUIDs. Convert names to UUIDs
before calling it.

Change-Id: I09d4104b42e858cf49242b191cd1aec17f9a8b8a
Closes-Bug: #1818541
(cherry picked from commit 03454b89a1451a3e6c2930a2f9217efb26cddea0)

commit_message:
Clean up node registration output.

The cell_v2_discover_hosts is an internal workflow
and doesn't need to send messages. It is retried by
the parent workflow as it is expected to fail, and
when it does we don't want it to send error messages
each time. which can be retried up to 30 times by
the parent workflow.

Change-Id: I4b8f8d153a8e8c2eabb9efadb52cf685e1f3759f
Closes-Bug: #1710685
(cherry picked from commit 206dd5ddabdec5eefb9ed9e2efddaaea67fa14b5)

commit_message:
Add trackbranch for Ocata

Track Ocata branch for internal roles, and leave the external
roles frozen. This branch also freezes ceph-ansible, unlike the
other branches, as this was using a tag for pre 3.0 branches.

Change-Id: I174842b5d1247332d4453579da4955d57cc71699

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-10 16:10:18.000000000', 'message': "Add trackbranch element

This is part of the plan to simplify releases.
When trackbranch value is not set, or set to None, the SHA
in version for the role will not update.
If it's set, SHA in version will be updated with the
HEAD of the branch expressed in trackbranch.

Freezing master for release can then be simply achieved by
setting trackbranch to the right branch.

Change-Id: I63274713cd3f7c00577bcebdd9d5b68e7b905e62
"}, {'created': '2019-03-10 16:11:56.000000000', 'message': "Add trackbranch element

Change-Id: I63274713cd3f7c00577bcebdd9d5b68e7b905e62

commit_message:
Add trackbranch element

This is part of the plan to simplify releases.
When trackbranch value is not set, or set to None, the SHA
in version for the role will not update.
If it's set, SHA in version will be updated with the
HEAD of the branch expressed in trackbranch.

Change-Id: I63274713cd3f7c00577bcebdd9d5b68e7b905e62

[{'created': '2019-03-20 12:34:23.000000000', 'message': "Remove UndercloudCtlplaneSubnets defaults in UC env

The defaults in environments/undercloud.yaml will be
merged with what the was defined in undercloud.conf.
If the 'ctlplane-subnet' is not used in undercloud.conf
the default is merged, and we end up with an additional
subnet that was not requested by the undercloud installed.

This change set the default to {} in:
  environments/undercloud.yaml

Also add's\xa0a comment to hightlight that there should be
a empty dict default.

Closes-Bug: #1820330
Change-Id: Idc17154b2e1e143ba4e84b9b96f5355fc9230172
(cherry picked from commit ea80847f9697f6b02f9cbaedcafc909e37ce5161)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove UndercloudCtlplaneSubnets defaults in UC env

The defaults in environments/undercloud.yaml will be
merged with what the was defined in undercloud.conf.
If the 'ctlplane-subnet' is not used in undercloud.conf
the default is merged, and we end up with an additional
subnet that was not requested by the undercloud installed.

This change set the default to {} in:
  environments/undercloud.yaml

Also add's a comment to hightlight that there should be
a empty dict default.

Closes-Bug: #1820330
Change-Id: Idc17154b2e1e143ba4e84b9b96f5355fc9230172
(cherry picked from commit ea80847f9697f6b02f9cbaedcafc909e37ce5161)

[{'created': '2019-03-21 13:57:48.000000000', 'message': '[Rocky-only] Install and configure tmpwatch for log cleanup

Installing and configuring tmpwatch allows to get rid of some
ugly things in logrotate configuration. As the container has no
network access anymore, we have to install the tool on the host
directly - this isn't that bad.

In order to avoid issues with logrotate manage logs, we explicitely
exclude patterns manage in the specific logorate configuration.

Also, always in order to avoid issues and ensure logrotate does its
own cleanup, we clean files one day later.

Note: this patch is the port of [1], without the "deployment" directory.
We can't really cherry-pick things since the tree is modified in master.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/641608

Change-Id: I5c59f337f2a62bc44e459f13de9bab6b4ab1a9f5

commit_message:
[Rocky-only] Install and configure tmpwatch for log cleanup

Installing and configuring tmpwatch allows to get rid of some
ugly things in logrotate configuration. As the container has no
network access anymore, we have to install the tool on the host
directly - this isn't that bad.

In order to avoid issues with logrotate manage logs, we explicitely
exclude patterns manage in the specific logorate configuration.

Also, always in order to avoid issues and ensure logrotate does its
own cleanup, we clean files one day later.

Note: this patch is the port of [1], without the "deployment" directory.
We can't really cherry-pick things since the tree is modified in master.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/641608

Change-Id: I5c59f337f2a62bc44e459f13de9bab6b4ab1a9f5

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Iea1d529fee535fc734bf0a305686a47698aa3964

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-11 21:32:45.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Testing all legacy jobs on bionic

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641886/
Change-Id: I0f30f6df6250ffb773c55ee4ecef0428d938d094
'}, {'created': '2019-03-13 01:51:52.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate legacy jobs to Ubuntu Bionic

We have migrated the zuulv3 job to Bionic during Dec/Jan month.
 - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000837.html
 - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
But that effort does not move all gate job to Bionic as there are
large amount of jobs are still legacy jobs. All the legacy jobs still
use Xenial as nodeset.

As per the decided runtime for Stein, we need to test everything on openstack
CI/CD on Bionic - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html

Below patch move the legacy base jobs to bionic which will move the derived jobs
automatically to bionic. These jobs are modified with branch variant so that they will use
Bionic node from stein onwards and xenial for all other stable branches
until stable/rocky.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096

This commit remove the overridden nodeset in legacy jobs so that it will
start using the nodeset defined in parent job.

More Details: 
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/legacy-job-bionic
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003614.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096
Change-Id: I0f30f6df6250ffb773c55ee4ecef0428d938d094
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate legacy jobs to Ubuntu Bionic

We have migrated the zuulv3 job to Bionic during Dec/Jan month.
 - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000837.html
 - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
But that effort does not move all gate job to Bionic as there are
large amount of jobs are still legacy jobs. All the legacy jobs still
use Xenial as nodeset.

As per the decided runtime for Stein, we need to test everything on openstack
CI/CD on Bionic - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html

Below patch move the legacy base jobs to bionic which will move the derived jobs
automatically to bionic. These jobs are modified with branch variant so that they will use
Bionic node from stein onwards and xenial for all other stable branches
until stable/rocky.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096

This commit remove the overridden nodeset in legacy jobs so that it will
start using the nodeset defined in parent job.

More Details: 
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/legacy-job-bionic
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003614.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096
Change-Id: I0f30f6df6250ffb773c55ee4ecef0428d938d094

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie31b57a58b5881f1895d398d8d1320126bdd9a78

[{'created': '2019-03-18 14:26:34.000000000', 'message': "Add SUSE Leap 15 Rocky images

This adds the build/publish/promote of OpenSUSE Leap 15 images
for Rocky. They are first built using LOCI's base Dockerfile,
then leverage the same process as Ubuntu Xenial, with the exception
of running on python3.

commit_message:
Add SUSE Leap 15 Rocky images

This adds the build/publish/promote of OpenSUSE Leap 15 images
for Rocky. They are first built using LOCI's base Dockerfile,
then leverage the same process as Ubuntu Xenial, with the exception
of running on python3.

Change-Id: I5ec719a5878fbca7c4fb17c785df82f80711349b

subject: Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
messages:
[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-25 15:37:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-25 15:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-25 15:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Squashed into https://review.openstack.org/#/c/647512/.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-25 15:37:12.000000000', 'message': 'Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts
value. This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only
a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an
evacuation can fail if the only available host is the one being
ignored.

This change makes the RequestSpec no longer persist the ignore_hosts
field like several other per-operation fields in the RequestSpec.
The only operations that use ignore_hosts are resize (if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False), evacuate and live migration, and
the field gets reset in each case to ignore the source instance.host.

The related functional recreate test is also updated to show the
bug is fixed.

Change-Id: I5a32215cc04a440d244d8f1cef5d734c758bb7d9
Closes-Bug: #1669054
'}]
commit_message:
Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts
value. This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only
a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an
evacuation can fail if the only available host is the one being
ignored.

This change makes the RequestSpec no longer persist the ignore_hosts
field like several other per-operation fields in the RequestSpec.
The only operations that use ignore_hosts are resize (if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False), evacuate and live migration, and
the field gets reset in each case to ignore the source instance.host.

The related functional recreate test is also updated to show the
bug is fixed.

Change-Id: I5a32215cc04a440d244d8f1cef5d734c758bb7d9
Closes-Bug: #1669054

commit_message:
Add feature to merge_config to support extra_config

We need a method to change conf file withtout modify custome conf file.
Only need putting "{{service_name}}_extra_configs" param to host_vars or
group_vars. This will help us achieve without touching file to config
service param.

Change-Id: Ib61b10aa2cc23cbed4b886afcbed25bfe87c48f8

commit_message:
Fix numbering for qinling-dashboard

qinling-dashboard is following a cycle-with-rc model but was
tagged 0.1.0. Let's push a 1.0.0.0rc1 at the same SHA.

We remove 0.1.0 from release history as it would otherwise fail
validation.

Change-Id: I94dcbb478c8d82b52f3cc80a56105decb726be67

commit_message:
Make sure openssl-perl is installed on split stack tls-everywhere deployments

Directory /etc/pki/CA is no longer available in CentOS 8 with base openssl
package. Libvirt still has the default to /etc/pki/CA for some TLS settings.
Lets add openssl-perl to get /etc/pki/CA and keep defaults where possible.

The package gets added to overcloud image and container via:
https://review.openstack.org/645498
https://review.openstack.org/645501

This check is mainly to make sure the package is also installed on
split stack deployments.

Change-Id: Id81ad942db6b193ab8b1dad537c65249348714d8
Related-Bug: #1821139

commit_message:
Ensure we configure SELinux at the earliest stage.

Prior this commit, SELinux was configured by puppet, and this
happens way too late. Here we should get a proper SELinux configuration
at the right time.

SELinux management is also removed from puppet with this commit:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/645477/
We just keep the "semodule" and "sebool" part within puppet. For now.

Related-Bug: #1821025
Closes-Bug: #1821178
Change-Id: Ibd7b80b2cc0b09b63b17f1ba3a9b9cc2de728c57

'overcloud update abort' command had been dropped since few
releases. However, users can still use heat commands to cancel

Undercloud now uses heat convergence architecture and stack check

commit_message:
Disable stack check and cancel update for undercloud

'overcloud update abort' command had been dropped since few
releases. However, users can still use heat commands to cancel
an update which is not recommended.

Undercloud now uses heat convergence architecture and stack check
has not been migrated to convergence yet.

let's add heat policy to disable both on undercloud. This change is
only specific for stable/queens.

Change-Id: I4180b380f4e95fe7d881fd403f638bc436af5f42

starts with "BOSS"

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I16e8b824925bd28126c6d10318d0d7bf5b3453ae

commit_message:
zuul: drop suse 42.3 jobs and move 15.0 to experimental

This follows the pattern we've adopted in all the other roles
being tested.

commit_message:
Bump up timeout for ceph jobs

Currently ceph jobs are often getting TIMED_OUT, increasing limit.

Change-Id: I3c6684984930d55a56da846bd8c3f19df2754b06

messages: [{'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-03-22 17:08:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-03-22 17:09:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1\n\nNot quite ready - needs tests for the get_db_url function'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-03-25 09:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-03-25 14:29:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-22 17:08:44.000000000', 'message': 'stein: migrate v1 firewalls -> v2

Ensure that the firewall v1->v2 migrate tool is executed post
upgrade to stein or later.

Fix minor issue with switch of default mysql dialect to mysqldb
at Stein by writing all new configuration files prior to
executing the database upgrade.

Change-Id: Ifb0b33038a4df7a2a6f5c1a55caaeea01a92fc20
Closes-Bug: 1821192
'}, {'created': '2019-03-25 09:04:38.000000000', 'message': 'stein: migrate v1 firewalls -> v2

Ensure that the firewall v1->v2 migrate tool is executed post
upgrade to stein or later.

Fix minor issue with switch of default mysql dialect to mysqldb
at Stein by writing all new configuration files prior to
executing the database upgrade.

Change-Id: Ifb0b33038a4df7a2a6f5c1a55caaeea01a92fc20
Closes-Bug: 1821192
'}]
commit_message:
stein: migrate v1 firewalls -> v2

Ensure that the firewall v1->v2 migrate tool is executed post
upgrade to stein or later.

Fix minor issue with switch of default mysql dialect to mysqldb
at Stein by writing all new configuration files prior to
executing the database upgrade.

Change-Id: Ifb0b33038a4df7a2a6f5c1a55caaeea01a92fc20
Closes-Bug: 1821192

commit_message:
Add role assignment test coverage for domain admins

This commit adds role assignment test coverage for users
who have the admin role assigned on the domain.

Subsequent patches will:

- add functionality for project readers
- add functionality for project members
- add functionality for project admins
- remove the obsolete policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

commit_message:
Add role assignment test coverage for domain members

This commit adds role assignment test coverage for
users who have the member role assigned on the domain.

Subsequent patches will:

- add functionality for domain admins
- add functionality for project readers
- add functionality for project members
- add functionality for project admins
- remove the obsolete policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

Partial-Bug: 1750673
Change-Id: I13fd19fb1d38ba43a22505e3fdbf552fddc949dd

[{'created': '2019-02-22 06:11:29.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] implement domain reader for role_assignments

This change adds tests cases for the default roles
keystone supports at install time. It also modifies
the policies for the role_assignments API to be more
self-service by properly checking for various scopes.

Subsequent patches will be uploaded for

domain member
domain admin
project reader
project member
project admin

Change-Id: I0c6d202a315d4683e2589f0d9121e93c97fb13e4

Change-Id: I0c6d202a315d4683e2589f0d9121e93c97fb13e4
'}, {'created': '2019-02-27 03:52:26.000000000', 'message': 'Implement domain reader for role_assignments

This change adds tests cases for the default roles
keystone supports at install time. It also modifies
the policies for the role_assignments API to be more
self-service by properly checking for scopes if accessed
with a domain-scoped tokens. This gives domain users the
power to query role assignments within the domain they
have authorization on without exposing other assignment
information in the deployment, domains, or projects.

Subsequent patches will:

  - add functionality for domain members
  - add functionality for domain admins
  - add functionality for project readers
  - add functionality for project members
  - add functionality for project admins
  - remove the obsolete policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

Partial-Bug: #1750673
Partial-Bug: #1816833
Change-Id: I0c6d202a315d4683e2589f0d9121e93c97fb13e4

commit_message:
Implement domain reader for role_assignments

This change adds tests cases for the default roles
keystone supports at install time. It also modifies
the policies for the role_assignments API to be more
self-service by properly checking for scopes if accessed
with a domain-scoped tokens. This gives domain users the
power to query role assignments within the domain they
have authorization on without exposing other assignment
information in the deployment, domains, or projects.

Subsequent patches will:

  - add functionality for domain members
  - add functionality for domain admins
  - add functionality for project readers
  - add functionality for project members
  - add functionality for project admins
  - remove the obsolete policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

Co-Authored-By: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>

Partial-Bug: 1750673
Change-Id: I0c6d202a315d4683e2589f0d9121e93c97fb13e4

commit_message:
Fix warnings in the document generation

* Fix warnings when executing 'tox -e docs'.
* Fix consistency for expressions of REST APIs.
* Remove 'json' in some code-blocks
  because the contents include comments
  so they are not in accordance with JSON format.
* Add the '-W' option in the sphinx-build command
  for the docs target.

Change-Id: Iaaa4e2444030622539a61055e114a649466be497
